description.en: This article explores critical directions in the study of cultural heritage and, in particular, in food heritage research. It aims to present local perspectives developed outside the mainstream heritage organizations. The strategies implemented jointly by peasants in rural Peru and non-governmental organizations committed to the promotion of cultural revival show how food reveals the symbiotic relationship between nature and culture in these indigenous worlds, and enables claims based on social, political and economic imaginaries. The initiatives described in this article are developed within transnational networks of partners and interlocutors, but outside universalist pretensions. They constitute a food heritage that differs from that of global cultural actors such as the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization and the United Nations by catering only to the needs of local communities and not conforming to mechanisms that bring prestige and income to States and powerful cultural entrepreneurs. Globally nurtured but locally applied, these locally based initiatives strategically and proactively seek and seize opportunities.
description.fr: Cet article explore les orientations critiques de l'étude du patrimoine culturel et, en particulier, de la recherche sur le patrimoine alimentaire. Il vise à fournir des perspectives locales développées en dehors des organisations patrimoniales traditionnelles. Les stratégies mises en œuvre conjointement par des paysans du Pérou rural et des organisations non gouvernementales engagées dans la promotion de la renaissance culturelle montrent comment la nourriture révèle la relation symbiotique entre la nature et la culture dans ces mondes indigènes, et permet des revendications fondées sur des imaginaires sociaux, politiques et économiques. Les initiatives décrites dans cet article se développent au sein de réseaux transnationaux de partenaires et d'interlocuteurs, mais sans prétention universaliste. Elles constituent un patrimoine alimentaire différent de celui des acteurs culturels mondiaux tels que l'Organisation des Nations unies pour l'éducation, la science et la culture et les Nations unies, car elles répondent uniquement aux besoins des communautés locales et ne se conforment pas aux mécanismes qui apportent prestige et revenus aux États et aux puissants entrepreneurs culturels. Nourries à l'échelle mondiale, mais mises en œuvre localement, ces initiatives locales recherchent et saisissent les opportunités de manière stratégique et proactive.
description.es: Este artículo explora direcciones críticas en el estudio del patrimonio cultural y, en particular, en la investigación del patrimonio alimentario. Su objetivo es dar a conocer perspectivas locales elaboradas al margen de las principales organizaciones patrimoniales. Las estrategias aplicadas conjuntamente por campesinos de zonas rurales de Perú y organizaciones no gubernamentales comprometidas con la promoción del resurgimiento cultural muestran cómo la alimentación revela la relación simbiótica entre naturaleza y cultura en estos mundos indígenas, y permite reivindicaciones basadas en imaginarios sociales, políticos y económicos. Las iniciativas descritas en este artículo se desarrollan dentro de redes transnacionales de socios e interlocutores, pero al margen de pretensiones universalistas. Constituyen un patrimonio alimentario que difiere del de agentes culturales globales como la Organización de las Naciones Unidas para la Educación, la Ciencia y la Cultura y las Naciones Unidas al atender únicamente las necesidades de las comunidades locales y no ajustarse a mecanismos que aportan prestigio e ingresos a los Estados y a los poderosos empresarios culturales. Alimentadas a escala mundial, pero aplicadas a escala local, estas iniciativas de base local buscan y aprovechan las oportunidades de forma estratégica y proactiva.
description.de: Dieser Artikel untersucht kritische Richtungen in der Erforschung des Kulturerbes und insbesondere der Forschung im Bereich des Lebensmittelerbes. Its goal is to deliver insight into local perspectives produced outside mainstream heritage organizations. Strategies implemented jointly by peasant farmers of rural Peru and non-governmental organizations committed to promoting cultural resurgence show how food discloses the symbiotic relationship between nature and culture in these indigenous worlds, and allows for claims grounded in social, political, and economic imaginaries. The initiatives described in this article develop within transnational networks of partners and interlocutors but outside of universalist pretensions. They constitute food heritage that differs from that of global cultural actors such as the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization and the United Nations by addressing only the needs of local communities and not complying with mechanisms which bring prestige and revenues to states and powerful cultural entrepreneurs. Globally nurtured, but locally implemented, these locally based initiatives seek out and take advantage of opportunities in strategic, proactive fashions.
